pullRequest.title: Issue #1404: Implemented tests for Configuration Api Services
pullRequest.bodyText:
Unfinished tests for two service configuration classes
Issue - #1404
Signed-off-by: Iurii_Kofanov youkofan@gmail.com

nodes.bodyText: Probably these changes have nothing to do with the pull request.
The change allows user to specify any owner in the request body therefore possibly gaining access to any run configuration. Let's not do that.
Please replace the field with the common constant.
Let's create an overloaded version of the method with only two arguments.
And also use common constant for id as well.

Let's use ANOTHER_SIMPLE_USER constant in abstract class for such cases. Currently it is pretty hard to read. In the context of the method TEST_STRING is the user name but the code reader doesn't know that.
Let's instantiate a new instance for run configuration vo just the same way you did in the test above. Please do the same for all similar cases below.
I'm thinking about making it more explicit like shouldDenySavingRunConfigurationWhenParentPermissionIsNotGranted.
And also please add final keyword.
Please extract EXECUTE along with other permissions to abstract class fields.
Please replace all the 1L with ID constant as well.
Let's extract common mocking to the class private methods.
It looks like some of the tests in the class fail. Could you please check? My guess would be the tests execution order which is not method declarations order.
But at the same time it looks like the bug in ACL. Could you please fix the acl (replacing configuration with id) and recheck that the tests execution order is fine.

Could you please remove the rule from config/pmd/pmd-ruleset.xml and then remove @SuppressWarnings since is not relevant anymore. We decided to get rid of this pmd rule because it doesn't seem to help the code style but just making everything harder.
